conclusion: To determine the heat exchanged, analyze each segment of the cycle using the first law of thermodynamics.
First law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
ΔU is the change in internal energy, Q is the heat added, W is the work done.
For an ideal gas, ΔU depends only on temperature change. In a cyclic process, ΔU = 0.
Net heat exchanged Q_net is equal to net work done W_net.
Process AB is an isothermal expansion.
For isothermal expansion AB, ΔU = 0 and Q_AB = W_AB.
Work done W_AB = nRT_0 ln(V2/V1).
Q_AB = nRT_0 ln(V2/V1).
Process BC is an isobaric expansion.
Work done W_BC = P2 (V2 - V1).
ΔU_BC = nC_V ΔT.
Q_BC = ΔU_BC + W_BC.
Process CD is an isothermal compression.
For isothermal compression CD, ΔU = 0 and Q_CD = W_CD.
Work done W_CD = -nRT_0 ln(V2/V1).
Q_CD = -nRT_0 ln(V2/V1).
Process DA is an isobaric compression.
Work done W_DA = -P1 (V2 - V1).
ΔU_DA = nC_V ΔT.
Q_DA = ΔU_DA + W_DA.
Net heat exchanged Q_net = Q_AB + Q_BC + Q_CD + Q_DA.
Net work done W_net = W_AB + W_BC + W_CD + W_DA.
